name: Acolyte
info: You devoted yourself to service in a Root-Sage church or secluded in a sacred grove. There you performed rites in honor of your ancestors of the Glow. You served under a priest and studied religion. Thanks to your priest's instruction and your own devotion, you also learned how to channel a modicum of divine power in service to your place of worship and the people who prayed there.

items.name: Equipment:
items.entry: Choose A or B: (A) {@item Calligrapher's Supplies}, {@item Book|Book (prayers)}, {@item Holy Symbol|Holy Symbol}, {@item Parchment|Patchment (10 sheets)}, {@item Robe|Robe}, 8 GP; or (B) 50 GP

name: Archivist
info: You spent your formative years in the Knowledge Ossuary, the subterranean archive of Bloomburrow's history kept by the Squirrellfolk. The Long River brings flotsam of artifacts and forgotten lore to the Ossuary, and you've spent many a restless night studying trinkets and scrolls. Your mind was sharpened in the archive, and you're ready to put your knowledge to use.

items.name: Equipment:
items.entry: Choose A or B: (A) {@item Quarterstaff}, {@item Calligrapher's Supplies}, {@item Book} (history), {@item Parchment} (8 sheets), {@item Robe}, 8 GP; or (B) 50 GP

name: Artisan
info: You began mopping floors and scrubbing counters in an artisan's workshop for a few acorns per day as soon as you were strong enough to carry a bucket. When you were old enough to apprentice, you learned to create basic crafts of your own, as well as how to barter and discern fine detail and value.

items.name: Tool Proficiency:
items.entry: Choose one kind of {@item Artisan's Tools}

items.name: Equipment:
items.entry: Choose A or B: (A) {@item Artisan's Tools} (same as above), 2 {@item Pouch|Pouches}, {@item Traveler's Clothes}, 32 GP; or (B) 50 GP

name: Caretaker
info: You've always had a level head and a knack for helping in dire situations. Perhaps you were raised in a large, busy family, or perhaps a crisis occurred when you were young that you jumped to solve. Once older, you tutored under a folk healer, learning how to identify healing herbs and how to apply medicine and care to all the different species of the Vale.

items.name: Equipment:
items.entry: Choose A or B: (A) {@item Quarterstaff}, {@item Herbalism Kit}, {@item Bedroll}, {@item Book} (philosophy), {@item Lamp}, {@item Oil} (3 flasks), {@item Traveler's Clothes}, 16 GP; or (B) 50 GP

name: Cook
info: You practically grew up in a kitchen, helping elders by preparing meals from a very young age. You've become familiar with many ingredients, and have developed an innate intuition on how to combine them into delicious dishes. Perhaps you've found work in a restaurant in a village or roadside inn.

items.name: Equipment:
items.entry: Choose A or B: (A) 1 {@item Book} (recipes), {@item Cook's Utensils}, {@item Fine Clothes}, {@item Oil} (3 flasks), {@item Iron Pot}, 6 GP; or (B) 50 GP

name: Criminal
info: You eked out a living cutting purses or burgling shops. Perhaps you grew up in the dark alleys of a large settlement like Brambleweave City, or perhaps you turned to banditry on the roads between towns. You may have run with a mercenary gang, like Crueljaw's infamous Purple Ivy Company

items.name: Equipment:
items.entry: Choose A or B: (A) {@item Dagger|2 Daggers}, {@item Thieves' Tools}, {@item Crowbar}, {@item Pouch|2 Pouches}, {@item Traveler's Clothes}, 16 GP; or (B) 50 GP

name: Entertainer
info: You spent much of your youth following Mousefolk bards and Otterfolk acrobats, performing odd jobs in exchange for lessons. You've developed your own routine or performance, and you thrive on applause and long for the stage.

items.name: Tool Proficiency:
items.entry: Choose one kind of {@item Musical Instrument}

items.name: Equipment:
items.entry: Choose A or B: (A) {@item Musical Instrument} (same as above), {@item Costume|2 Costumes}, {@item Mirror}, {@item Perfume}, {@item Traveler's Clothes}, 11 GP; or (B) 50 GP

name: Farmer
info: You grew up close to the land, perhaps a Rabbitfolk garden or Squirrelfolk food reserve. Years tending insects and cultivating the earth rewarded you with patience and good health. You have a keen appreciate for nature's bounty and a healthy respect for nature's wrath.

items.name: Equipment:
items.entry: Choose A or B: (A) {@item Sickle}, {@item Carpenter's Tools}, {@item Healer's Kit}, {@item Iron Pot}, {@item Shovel}, 30 GP; or (B) 50 GP

name: Fisher
info: You have spent your life aboard fishing boats on the Long River or combing the shallows for the bounty of the Purelake. Perhaps you were taught by a family of Frogfolk or Otterfolk, working to help feed your village. Regardless of how you began, you soon fell in love with the water, the art of fishing, and the promise of the eternal horizon.

items.name: Equipment:
items.entry: Choose A or B: (A) {@item Bedroll}, {@item Dagger}, {@item Fishing Tackle}, {@item Navigator's Tools}, {@item Net}, {@item Trident}, {@item Traveler's Clothing}, 12 GP; or (B) 50 GP

name: Guard
info: Your feet ache when you remember the countless hours you spent at your post in Brambleweave City. You were trained to keep one eye looking outside the wall, watching for signs of Beasts or Vermin, and your other eye looking inside the wall, searching for bandits and troublemakers.

items.name: Tool Proficiency:
items.entry: Choose one kind of {@item Gaming Set}

items.name: Equipment:
items.entry: Choose A or B: (A) {@item Spear}, {@item Light Crossbow}, 20 {@item Bolt|Bolts}, {@item Gaming Set} (same as above), {@item Hooded Lantern}, {@item Manacles}, {@item Quiver}, {@item Traveler's Clothes}, 12 GP; or (B) 50 GP

name: Guide
info: You came of age outdoors, far from settled lands. Your home was anywhere you chose to spread your bedroll. There are wonders in the wilderness of the Hollow Vale — strange insects, Vermin, overgrown ruins — and you learned to fend for yourself as you explored them. From time to time, you've found work as a courier, wilderness guide, or insect hunter.

items.name: Equipment:
items.entry: Choose A or B: (A) {@item Shortbow}, {@item Arrow|20 Arrows}, {@item Cartographer's Tools}, {@item Bedroll}, {@item Quiver}, {@item Tent}, {@item Traveler's Clothes}, 3 GP; or (B) 50 GP

name: Innkeeper
info: You spent your youth scrubbing floors and counters in a travelling caravan of Squirrelfolk, and you soon became a popular regular fixture at the Inn. You were taken under the wing of the owner, and were taught how to run the business and sweet talk your patrons. You've even learned a few recipes for brewing spirits.

items.name: Equipment:
items.entry: Choose A or B: (A) {@item Brewer's Supplies}, {@item Fine Clothes}, 3 {@item Glass Bottle}s , {@item Iron Pot}, {@item Oil} (3 flasks), 6 GP; or (B) 50 GP

name: Merchant
info: You were apprenticed to a trader, caravan master, or shopkeeper, learning the fundamentals of commerce. You traveled broadly, and you earned a living by buying and selling the raw materials artisans need to craft or finished works from such crafters. You might have transported goods from one place to another (by ship, wagon, or caravan) or bought them from traveling traders and sold them in your own shop.

items.name: Equipment:
items.entry: Choose A or B: (A) {@item Navigator's Tools}, {@item Pouch|2 Pouches}, {@item Traveler's Clothes}, 22 GP; or (B) 50 GP

name: Noble
info: There is no single authority in the Vale, but you were raised as the heir of a mayor, important councilman, or group leader - surrounded by wealth, power, and privilege. Your family ensured you received a first-class education in History and Diplomacy, and it was always expected that you would one day fill a position of leadership.

items.name: Tool Proficiency:
items.entry: Choose one kind of {@item Gaming Set}

items.name: Equipment:
items.entry: Choose A or B: (A) {@item Gaming Set} (same as above), {@item Fine Clothes}, {@item Perfume}, 29 GP; or (B) 50 GP

name: Sailor
info: You lived on the Long River that cuts across the Vale - wind at your back and decks swaying beneath your feet. You were raised alongside Otterfolk sailors (or brigands), and perched on barstools in more ports of call than you can remember. Along the river you've faced mighty storms, enormous river Beasts, and even pirates.

items.name: Equipment:
items.entry: Choose A or B: (A) {@item Dagger}, {@item Navigator's Tools}, {@item Rope}, {@item Traveler's Clothes}, 20 GP; or (B) 50 GP

name: Scavenger
info: You grew up on the fringes of society, perhaps on the streets of a settlement like Brambleweave City, or perhaps on the outskirts of villages. You slept where you could and did odd jobs for food. You've learned to take what's been discarded or left unused, never letting anything go to waste.

items.name: Equipment:
items.entry: Choose A or B: (A) {@item Dagger|2 Daggers}, {@item Thieves' Tools}, {@item Gaming Set} (any), {@item Bedroll}, {@item Pouch|2 Pouches}, {@item Traveler's Clothes}, 16 GP; or (B) 50 GP

name: Soldier
info: Every settlement in the Vale needs to be ready for Beasts, Vermin, and insects; and many companies of mercenaries and knights form to stand vigilant. You began your martial training with one such group as soon as you reached adulthood and carry precious few memories of life before you took up arms. Battle is in your blood, and you put your training to use on the battlefield, protecting the Vale by waging war.

items.name: Tool Proficiency:
items.entry: Choose one kind of {@item Gaming Set}

items.name: Equipment:
items.entry: Choose A or B: (A) {@item Spear}, {@item Shortbow}, {@item Arrow|20 Arrows}, {@item Gaming Set} (same as above), {@item Healer's Kit}, {@item Quiver}, {@item Traveler's Clothes}, 14 GP; or (B) 50 GP
